A family stares bored at “Soyburger and Numbers.” The Mot starts channel surfing. She hits the Muppets. The LITTLE GIRL starts laughing joyfully at the antics. INT. TEX RICHMAN’S SUPER HIGH TECH NERVE CENTER The graph of viewers watching the Muppet show moves up.
Sir, we have a problem.

Just a commercial break. Nothing to worry about. INT. GEORGE CLOONEY’S MOD HOUSE - DAY George Clooney is watching television on an enormous flat screen and flipping through the channels. He lands on Gon spinning the bowling ball as Jack Black flinches. The ent audience laughs hysterically. George Clooney laughs and t looks angry. George Clooney picks up the phone and dials.
Why am I not a part of the Greatest Muppet Benefit Ever? Jack Black is killing.
People stream into the audience, filling it up. INT. WALTER’S DRESSING ROOM - NIGHT Gary pokes his head in. Walter could not be more relaxed.
Great news! The theater’s packed!  81. Walter instantly starts shaking, turns to Gary.
Oh. Great. You know, if you wouldn't mind, I think I just need a second alone? Just to get excited.
Of course, buddy. Everything will be great! And just so you know... I’m nervous too.

Who said anything about being nervous? Walter tries in vain not to shake again. Gary smiles reassuringly and heads out. Walter starts to hyperventila Walter starts running around his dressing room in spazzy circles, dashes to the window, and crashes through it.
Gonzo continues to spin his arm in a circle.
Just make it end already! The audience laughs. Kermit steps in front of them.

We'll get to see what happens with Head Bowling later in the show! And now FOZZIE BEAR! !!! Jack and Gonzo get rolled off stage, Gonzo’s arm still spinning, Jack still flinching. Fozzie comes onstage.

So glad to see you all made it, especially with the traffic being so bad. You know what I do to get through traffic? Grin and bear it. No one laughs except for the ABC Executive who’s having a oddly great time. ANGLE ON Kermit getting nervous. He and Rowlf see Sweetums heading for the mysterious lever. He l to Rowlf at the piano and gives him a nod to play him off but again, Rowlf refuses. George Clooney suddenly walks p Kermit and onto the stage.

Is it me or is it getting hot in here? Wish I could take off my coat! Waca waca! George Clooney heads onstage behind Fozzie. The audience cheers and laughs. Fozzie smiles, thinking his joke worke out. Then he turns.
George Clooney! Oh my goodness! You made it!!
Just Bear-ily. Traffic was grizzly! Waca Waca Waca!! The crowd erupts in laughter.
Wait a minute, I just did almost the same joke! You’11 laugh at his puns but not mine!?!
I'm a big star Fozzie, they’1l laugh at anything I do.
Not Leatherheads. The crowd erupts in laughter, the ABC Exec chief among th
Geez, will you lay off Leatherheads already?!

What? You should be happy. That’s the biggest laugh that movie ever got! The crowd goes nuts. CUT TO A GRID OF CELEBRITIES in their various houses watc their television, including CHRIS ROCK, MARTIN SHORT, JON

head_text.subj: MEYER, NORAH JONES, SARAH JESSICA PARKER, HARRISON FORD,

text: STILLER and really whoever we think we can get, picking u their phones and calling their agents.  83.

Clooney's killing!/Why am I not on this thing?/I want in!/I'm twice the talent of Clooney! He’s just a pretty face! PAN DOWN A ROW OF HOUSES IN THE SUBURBS AS WE SEE televis flipping to the Muppet Show Benefit. INT. TEX RICHMAN’S SUPER HIGH TECH NERVE CENTER The graph of viewers watching the Muppet Show goes higher
What? People are actually watching this. That can’t be. (then, epiphany) I got it! Bobo! Check to see if I own the network!

GONZO is surrounded by Dr. Honeydew, Kermit, the ABC Executive and SEVERAL MUPPET DOCTORS who are trying to de the bowling ball from his rapidly spinning arm. He KNOCKS few of the doctors away. Jack is still tied up in his cha flinching.
Could you at least move me away from the trajectory of the bowling ball? Please? ANGLE ON THE CAMERAS as the camera men shut them down. Kermit runs up to them.
What're you doing?
The owner of the network, Tex Richman, wants us to shut down. Sorry. Let’s go, boys. The cameramen leave. The ABC Executive runs on.
Not to fear! I am personally turning them back on.
But if you go down --  84.
-- then at least I’ll have seen a great show. Several Muppets run to the cameras and FLIP THEM BACK ON.
Do you know how to work one of these things?
I don’t know how to make television. I’m just a TV executive, but we'll figure it out.
Kermit REAPPEARS on the television. The camera work is terrible. Half Kermit’s head is off screen.

Sorry about that little technical difficulty! Now let’s give a round of applause for Dr. Teeth and Electric Mayhem!!! INT. TEX RICHMAN’S SUPER HIGH TECH NERVE CENTER Tex Richman and Bobo are in the nerve center.
They're back on the air! And as hilarious as ever! Tex shoots Bobo a look. BOBO (CONT’D) I mean, and as annoying and terrible as ever.

Only one thing to do now. Tex PULLS OUT wire cutters. TEX RICHMAN (CONT’D) Get up on the roof and shut them down. Time to mothball these felt- brained morons. Bobo looks upset. They LEAVE the high tech nerve center  85.
-- and we reveal the high tech nerve center somehow fits inside an OSCAR MEYER WEINER MOBILE that’s parked right outside the Muppet Studios.
They get up to the giant antennae. Tex takes his giant wi cutters out and raises them like he’s making a toast.
To the end of Puppets, Muppets and Marionettes and to the sipping of tasty tasty Texas teal!!! Bobo grabs the wire cutters and tosses them away. TEX RICHMAN (CONT’D) What’re you doing?
Enough is enough, Tex.
Enough is never enough, see!? And don’t forget about the tea! The delectable black tea!
It is true, Tex. I do love oil. But I am a Muppet in my heart. And I promise, you'll always remember how this “felt!”
What does that mean?
It’s a pun! Bobo HITS Tex off the roof.
The band is about to play when JON MEYER, BRUCE SPRINGSTE and NORAH JONES join them.
Would you mind very much if we joined you?  86.
If you have to. Animal, you sure you don’t want to play drums?
Can’t... touch... drums. Drums Bad! Flute good!

They're here if you want ‘em. (to Bruce, Jon and Norah) Just follow my lead. Keep the vocals tight and splashy. Anda one, two, three go!!! They start playing. INSERT SONG HERE BETWEEN JON MEYER, BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN AND NORAH JONES.
Fozzie comes up to Rowlf, still a tiny bit defensive.
Well. You didn’t have to play me off this time! Rowlf walks over to the mysterious lever back stage.

I would never do anything to hurt you old friend. That’s why I played you off that day. This lever opens a trap door to a shark tank. The network made us put it in back in the day for acts that weren’t working.
What? A shark tank? I don’t believe you! Fozzie hastily pulls the lever.
Fozzie looks to Rowlf gratefully. With screaming in the background, they hug.  87.
Ohmigod! Bruce is literally riding a shark! He can do anything!
Walter runs in a blind panic.
Abhhhh! He stops, out of breath, then starts running again.
Ahhhh!

CHINESE CHICKEN BALLET - Camilla, a bunch of chickens and Barysnikov dance in traditional Chinese costumes. HOMEMADE SALSA - The Swedish Chef dumps tomatoes, onion a hot peppers onto the floor. Then he and Rachel Ray do a sultry salsa dance over the ingredients. DINNER THEATER - The curtain rises to reveal a beautifull set table filled with FOOD MUPPETS (a Muppet bread loaf, Muppet roast with eyes, a Muppet basket of vegetables.) T begin performing Romeo and Juliet. ARNOLD SCHWARZENHEIFER AND HIS OPERATIC MUSSELS - The cur rises to reveal a pig dressed like Arnold Schwarzenegger Terminator-style black leather jacket. He starts to sing aria. He PULLS OFF his jacket to reveal he’s covered in MUPPET MUSSELS, as in the shellfish. They all join in on aria. ANGLE ON THE GRAPH: Muppet viewers go up and up.
Gary runs up to Mary and her class.
What’re you doing out here? Don’t you still have to perform?
I wanted to thank you for coming.  88.
Miss Piggy invited me. She explained everything. And then we sang about how hard it is to be a woman in a man’s world. It was really inspiring.
I love you.
And I love you. Mary and Gary kiss. ANGLE ON THE CURTAIN: Kermit, peering from behind the curtain, sees them kissing and realizes Gary’s not dating Piggy.

Kermit looks from Mary and Gary kissing to Piggy who star dramatically at a beautiful sunset and ocean vista as a w gently blows her hair. Kermit NERVOUSLY GOES over to her. REVEAL that she’s standing in front of an ocean vista set that a fan is pointed her way.
What do you want?
Listen Piggy. I’ve been doing some thinking.
Caw Caw. REVEAL Fozzie standing there. Kermit and Piggy turn to hi
What was that?
A seagull. To increase the romantic atmosphere. Kermit and Piggy stare at him until he leaves.
And, well... I was just wondering if maybe, you might want to...  89.
I won’t sing our duet. I just can’t bare the heartache any longer.
(returning) I can bear it! Waca Waca
Fozzie leaves again.
It’s not about the duet. I’ve missed all of you so much. But the person I missed the most is you. I’d rather be legless than not be with you.
You’1l move to Paris? Kermit nods. PIGGY LEAPS UP EXCITEDLY!!! MISS PIGGY (CONT’D)

Music up: Opening strains of I’m Your Puppet. They gaze i each other's eyes. Kermit leans in and kisses Miss Piggy the music begins to swell. Kermit extends his hand. Piggy throws off her rope revealing the most beautiful gown a p has ever worn. She takes his hand. They walk a few steps hand in hand. Then: MISS PIGGY (CONT’D) (screaming) SORRY GARY! I’M DOING MY DUET WITH
She smiles at Kermit and they walk out of frame together.

The curtain opens. Kermit’s in a tux on a crescent moon p with Miss Piggy in a chiffon bridal gown. The band starts playing, Animal still not at the drums. Miss Piggy and Kermit sing “I’M YOUR PUPPET.” The graph SPIKES TO 9.5 MILLION VIEWERS!!! The audience claps. Gary and Mary watc on smiling.  90.
I should go check on Walter! He’s up next! They peck and he heads backstage. INT. WALTER’S DRESSING ROOM Gary opens the door. Walter’s gone, the window broken.
Oh no. Kermit arrives, excited.
Alright!!! It’s time for the big closer, is he ready?? Kermit sees the broken window and SCREAMS!!!
He must have gotten stage fright!
(to Gary) We've got to find him! Let’s split up! Go! GO! (Gary exits, then to Scooter) Find someone to fill! We’ve almost made it!!!
But sir, we’re running out of stars! We’re really scraping the bottom of the barrel now!!!! ANGLE ON BILL HADER about to go onstage.
I heard that.
Walter stops running and stops in front of an electronics store with several televisions in the window playing the Muppet Benefit Show.
What’re you doing, Walter?  gl. Walter turns to find Gary running up to him.
How did you find me?

This is where people always go when they’re running away from a personal challenge. See? REVEAL that there’s a woman dressed as the witch from Wic Conan O’Brien and a guy in a Jack in the Box uniform.
(talking to herself) What if I forget all the lyrics? What then! ? CONAN O’BRIEN (talking to himself) I just don’t know if I can do another show tonight and keep up the quality!
(talking to himself) What if I can’t master how to make the BBQ Bacon Sirloin burger?! BACK TO WALTER.
I don’t have an act! I can only go out there if you go with me!
Are you sure? I mean this is your big chance... WALTER JUMPS ONTO GARY’S ARM AND SLAPS HIM.
I can’t handle the pressure!!!!! I can only do it if you’re there with me!!! Please!!!!
Anything you need buddy. You still remember our routine?
I’m pretty sure. Let’s go!  92. Gary and Walter turn, revealing that the Muppet Studios a right behind them.
It felt like I ran way farther. They run into the studio.
Scooter’s off stage, panicked. Fozzie on stage looks to Scooter and gestures “What now?” Scooter looks around concerned, sees Chef walking by, grabs him and pushes him onstage.

And now, for an encore, the Swedish Chef! Chef walks on stage tentatively, no act prepared. THE GRA IS HOLDING STEADY AT 9.5 MILLION. No phones ring. Chef lo around the stage. There’s no cooking equipment set up. He stands there silently. The audience grows impatient. Angle on: Backstage the Muppets look around nervously. IN

head_text.subj: FLASH BEAKER AND HONEYDEW QUICKLY WHEEL THE SLOW MOTION
MACHINE ON STAGE RIGHT TO CHEF AND QUICKLY TURN THE DIAL

text: “PASTA.” DELICIOUS SPAGHETTI AND MEATBALLS FLY EVERYWHERE AND CHEF GOES NUTS.
The audience applauds. More silence. THE GRAPH HAS NOT
NODS TO FOZZIE! Fozzie quickly runs to the microphone.

Now get ready for the biggest event of the night, Gary and our newest Muppet, Walter!!!!! Fozzie claps and walks offstage leaving Gary holding Walt like a puppet, like the act they did at the beginning of movie in Venice. They’re both in tuxes. The band begins playing.
We're friends...  93.
Oh yes we're friends...
Until the end...
The very end...

And nothing, no sir, nothing... Without warning, Gary TOSSES Walter off his hand and onto stage! IN SLOW MOTION, Walter flies through the air and gives Gary a “what are you doing” look. Walter lands, lim on the stage. The audience lets out a SHOCKED GASP! A lon silent moment. GARY (CONT’D) (sotto to Walter) C'mon, Walt. You can do it. This is your big chance, I’m not letting you pass it up. Long beat. Then Walter sits up.
Can tear us apart!!! Walter begins tap dancing... INCREDIBLY WELL. The audienc applauds loudly.
I’m a dancer! That’s it!!! MY

head_text.subj: MUPPET TALENT IS I CAN DANCE

text: Gary smiles and slowly takes a step back to give Walter center stage. Walter is a brilliant and diverse dancer. H does ballet, then capoeira, then a somersault and a cartwheel. The audience is going nuts. As his dance solo comes to an end, Walter does a standing backflip and land flawlessly RIGHT ON GARY’S HAND! It should look like a mi Cirque de Soleil, Stomp and Crouching Tiger, Hidden Drago
No nothing! Nothing!
Can tear!

Apart!i!!t! Gary tosses Walter up into a triple flip which really jus looks like someone threw a puppet up into the air. He dro onto the ground on his feet. THE CROWD GOES NUTS! Phone’s are ringing off the hook! The graph spikes to 9.9 Million viewers. The crowd rises to its feet in anticipation as t graph ticks closer to 10 million. Muppets run on stage exuberantly and hug Walter and Gary and each other. Gonzo bowling ball still spinning in his arm dances around the stage. Suddenly the lights go out and house lights come o Tex Richman HAS APPEARED on stage. He pulls a GIANT RIFLE OUT and points it at Kermit and Miss Piggy. THE GRAPH ABRUPTLY STOPS AT 9,999,999.
I tried to negotiate. I tried to talk reason. But no, you all had to put on a show and make America fall in love with you all over again. Well how’s this for a show, America?
Somebody arrest him! He’s got a gun!
I’m aiming at a pig and a frog! What they gonna get me for, hunting without a license?! Just as Tex is about to pull the trigger the movie FREEZE DR. HONEYDEW appears.
We here at Muppet Labs are aware that puppetry is not the most advanced form of entertainment. His assistants PULL the Temporal Displace Machine on scre
Therefore we now present to you the top secret fourth setting of the Temporal Displacement Machine dial. Dr. Honeydew flips the dial PAST PASTA to “Bullet-Point-o View-O-Matic.”  95.

Bullet-Point-of-View-O-Matic. Once the fake Texan pulls the trigger, we will go into an exciting computer animated point of view of a slo mo bullet, thus bringing you the cutting edge of visual stimuli! BACK TO THE ACTION.

If I don’t get my oil, then no one does. Dr. Honeydew FLIPS ON THE DEVICE and then GOES OFFSCREEN. Tex Richman PULLS THE TRIGGER. We go to BULLET POINT OF V ie. We’re looking down the shaft of the rifle at Kermit a Miss Piggy. Everyone is now moving in slo-mo. The gun fires! And the bullet emerges... as a puppet bullet at th end of a stick with whooshing bullet noises made by the Muppet who’s holding the stick. The Muppets are moving in slomo, but it should be clear that they’re pretending to in slomo. Fozzie walks in.
What’s going on guys?
Ixnay ormalnay eedspay!

Oh, slo mo bullet pov! Sorry! Fozzie goes into slo mo as well, blinking. He follows the bullet with his eyes, like a bad actor, mouth open, eyes super wide. The bullet continues on its trajectory toward Kermit and Miss Piggy. Tex is smiling evil-y when Gonzo’s bowling ball suddenly FLIES OFF HIS FINGERS and BLOCKS th bullet! We RESUME NORMAL SPEED!
What! No! Tex pumps his gun and is about to fire again when Piggy KARATE CHOPS it out of his hands.
The audience cheers. But the graph does not move.
What’s happening, why did the graph stop?  96.
Looks like you’ve run out of viewers- and luck!! And just in time. He motions to a clock on the graph as it ticks to midnigh series of sad buzzer sounds go off and the graph flashes

YEEEEE-HAAAAWWWWWWWWWW. The studio is mine see!!!! It’s mine!!!! And so are the Muppets!!! You gaggle of misfits will never make anyone not laugh ever again!!!!! The crowd and the Muppets are in stunned silence. Angle o Statler and Waldorf.
Waldorf, I don’t know what to say. I feel... sad.
I don’t get it?
It’s not a sardonic joke, it’s the truth.

Oh. Ummm. I guess I do to. Waldorf begins to cry, followed by Statler. The audience begins to cry. A series of quick shots of home viewers also crying. All of our celebrities back stage are crying. On stage, all of the Muppets begin to cry and comfort eac other. Tex watches on pleased. Fozzie, determined, steps forward.
(holding back tears) Everyone stop crying! Don’t give him the satisfaction! This isn’t over!  97.
Oh it’s as over as Barney the Dinosaur. Nothing you can do. The Muppets are done for good!!

You might own the studio, and you might own the Muppets, but you don’t own our friendship and as long as we got that... well we’1ll figure something out. I promise you, this ain’t over! You messed with the wrong bear! So don’t you worry Tex Richman, I guarantee “oil” be seeing you very soon!! Long beat as Tex Richman stares at Fozzie. Something begi to happen to his face. He looks pained. It takes a long t but finally a strange sound emerges from Tex... a laugh. grows and he begins laughing hard.

(laughing) “Oil” be seeing you. I get it. Because it sounds like “I'll be seeing you”, but instead you said “Oil”, because of my obsessive, almost cartoonish love of Oil! I get it!!!! I'm laughing!!!! I'M LAUGHING!!!! HAHAHAHAH!! “OIL!I!!!1”

Tex falls to his knees crying he is laughing so hard. Everyone watches on confused. TEX RICHMAN (CONT’D) (through tears and laughter) You made me laugh!!! Finally!! Thank you!!! Keep it!!! You can keep the studio!!! It’s yours!! Just keep making me laugh!!!
Are you kidding, we're a “barrel” of laughs. Tex immediately stops laughing and glares at Fozzie.
A barrel!? Like a barrel of oil? Tex thinks, then shakes his head no.  98.
Do the other one again.
Oil be seeing you later? Tex starts laughing hard again.
Yes!!! That’s the one!!! HAHAHAHA. It’s yours, the studio is yours!!
We did it, Kermy! We did it!

We did do it. And we did it together!!! WE’RE BACK!! (to the Muppets) And if it’s okay with you guys. (to the audience) And if it’s okay with all of you, well, we want to bring back The Muppet Show! I want to do this every week! With more acts, and more laughter and more fun! What do you say!?! All the Muppets and the crowd erupts in cheers. Miss Pigg and Kermit hug. The Muppets go into a FINAL GIANT MUSICAL
(singing)

The music ends. Except for the drums. ANGLE ON ANIMAL who is playing the drums. MUPPETS (CONT’D) (singing) Together again! Animal won't stop playing the drums. MUPPETS (CONT’D) (singing) Ain't it good to be...! Animal still won’t stop playing.  99.
I think we’re done here, Animal.
Don’t touch him. He’s working something out.
Ah! Ahhhh! Drums taking hold!!!! Animal's going crazy on the drums. Animal pounds on the drums so hard he starts to bash his way through the drums into the ground. He’s digging a hole with the drums.
Someone stop him! Mortar and bricks fly out of the hole as Animal digs hims deeper and deeper. Then silence...
Uh oh. There’s an UNEARTHLY SHAKING and suddenly...
oil. Animal SHOOTS OUT OF THE WHOLE on a FOUNTAIN OF OIL.
The fountain of oil SHOOTS THROUGH THE ROOF, Animal ridin the top of it.
The Muppets running this way and that. Oil fountains star BURSTING through the floorboards. Chaos.
In our one or maybe two CGI shots in the entire film, we a wide shot of Los Angeles, oil fountains exploding ridiculously high into the air under the Muppet Studio.  100.
The gang celebrate under the sweet, sweet oil.
I loved that whole kidnapping bit. How'd you think of it?
That was no bit. I was kidnapped. I was scared for my life.
(laughing) You are a crack up. You and your family should come out to Lake Como. We'll drink Chianti on jet skis. WE PAN to Tex Richman in HANDCUFFS. A BUSINESSMAN comes u to him.
I represent the shareholders of Richman Oil. You are hereby relieved of your duties as CEO.
What? Why? All I live for is tasty, tasty oil!

Because instead of doing the work that being a CEO of a global multinational corporation requires, you spent all your time in disguise trying to get the oil that’s under the Muppet studios. You realize there’s only like twenty barrels down there? As he says that the oil fountain immediately DRIES UP.
Good day, Tex. ANGLE ON Walter, Gary, Piggy and Kermit.
Terrific dancing, Walter. One of the best Muppet performances I’ve ever seen!! We’d be really happy if you wanted to join us on the Muppet Show!  101. Beat...
Peaaaaaaaaaaaaa...almond!
At least he’s moved onto a different kind of nut. Kermit and Miss Piggy head off. Mary shows up.
Amazing, guys. Really amazing.
It was all him./It was all him.
Walter, I have a friend I’d like to introduce you to. We met in the ladies room. She couldn’t stop talking about your act. From behind Mary steps a PINK REPLICA of Walter.
Hi. I’m Penelope.
Pleasure to meet you. I’m Walter.

(shaking) PPPPPP...Penelope! I’m a big fan. PPPPPP....Penelope!! Against the full moon, Gary and Mary kiss. We PAN past th to Kermit and Miss Piggy kissing, to Gonzo and Camilla th Chicken kissing to the Swedish Chef and Rachel Ray kissin A photographer runs in front of all the Muppets. We recog him as the same photographer who took the fated “TIME” picture years ago.
Kermit! A picture! Kermit shakes his head no.
Sorry sir. Not this time. Not without my friends. The Muppets all look to each other and smile. They gather put their arms around each other.  102.
(as he bites into some) Say CHEESE!!!!! Flash. Our gang, together, smiling. PAPER UP: THE MUPPETS
Back to live: The Muppets hug and celebrate. We pull up f final crane shot when the MAHNA MAHNA CREATURE jumps into frame and we pull back to closeup.
Manamana! The TWO SNOWTHS pop into frame.
Doo doo da da da!
Manamana!
Doo doo doo doo! We close with A MONTAGE OF EVERYONE in the film, Muppets, actors, celebrities, crew, etc. singing Manamana with Mah Mahna. FADE OUT.
